what: Calculate Ecosystem Gas Fluxes From Raw Data
title: Calculate Ecosystem Gas Fluxes From Raw Data
text: goal fluxible provide workflow removes individual evaluation flux, reduces risk bias, makes reproducible. Users set specific data quality standards selection parameters function arguments applied entire dataset. package runs calculations automatically, without prompting user take decisions mid-way, provides quality flags plots end process visual check. makes easy use large flux datasets integrate reproducible workflow. Using Fluxible R package makes workflow reproducible, increases compatibility across studies, time efficient.

title: Calculate Ecosystem Gas Fluxes From Raw Data
text: can install development version fluxible GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("jogaudard/fluxible")

title: Calculate Ecosystem Gas Fluxes From Raw Data
text: basic example sample data Plant Functional Traits Course 6 (2022). flux_match function matches field measured gas concentration data flux meta data: calculate flux slopes flux necessary. flux_fitting function can provide linear exponential fit. Let’s start linear fit. assess quality fit use flux_quality. add quality flags advising calculated slopes kept, replaced 0 NA. Users still visual check flux_plot function. flux_plot function plots fluxes fluxID, modelled measured concentration, indicating quality flags color codes. plots can printed R console, saved pdf document easier use. Depending plots user can re-run flux_fitting cuts start end measurements (applied entire dataset), change type fit, decide exclude specific fluxes using ‘weird_fluxes’ argument.  using linear fit, might better use short portion start flux. can re run ‘flux_fitting’ end cut, run ‘flux_quality’ ‘flux_plot’ see better.  exponential fit used similar way. uses exponential expression shown Zhao et al. (2018). quality assessment. default slope_col argument linear fit, now specify . plots also show modelled slope t zero.  , can try cut needed.  satisfied fit, can calculate fluxes ’‘’flux_calc’.

NA 4 AN1C 4 NEE   #> # ℹ 15 more variables: f_start <dttm>, f_end <dttm>, f_fluxID <fct>, #> #   f_n_conc <int>, f_ratio <dbl>, f_flag_match <chr>, f_time <dbl>, #> #   f_cut <fct>, n_conc <int>, f_rsquared <dbl>, f_adj_rsquared <dbl>, #> #   f_pvalue <dbl>, f_intercept <dbl>, f_slope <dbl>, f_fit <dbl> slopes_lin_liahovden <- flux_quality(slopes_lin_liahovden, fit_type = "lin") head(slopes_lin_liahovden) #> # A tibble: 6 × 25 #>   f_datetime          temp_air temp_soil f_conc   PAR turfID   type  #>   <dttm>                 <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    <chr> #> 1 2022-07-27 05:37:40       NA        NA   465. NA 4 AN1C 4 NEE   #> 4 2022-07-27 05:37:43       NA        NA   464.    NA 4 AN1C 4 NEE   #> 5 2022-07-27 05:37:44       NA        NA   464.    NA 4 AN1C 4 NEE   #> 6 2022-07-27 05:37:45       NA        NA   463.    NA 4 AN1C 4 NEE   #> # ℹ 18 more variables: f_start <dttm>, f_end <dttm>, f_fluxID <fct>, #> #   f_n_conc <int>, f_ratio <dbl>, f_flag_match <chr>, f_time <dbl>, #> #   f_cut <fct>, n_conc <int>, f_rsquared <dbl>, f_adj_rsquared <dbl>, #> #   f_pvalue <dbl>, f_intercept <dbl>, f_slope <dbl>, f_fit <dbl>, #> #   f_start_error <chr>, f_quality_flag <chr>, f_slope_corr <dbl> slopes_lin_liahovden |>   dplyr::filter(f_fluxID %in% c(53:56)) |> # we just show a sample of the plots to avoid slowing down the example     flux_plot(       fit_type = "lin",       print_plot = TRUE,       f_plotname = "example_lia",       f_ylim_lower = 300,       f_ylim_upper = 600,       f_nrow = 1       ) #> [1] "Saving plots in f_quality_plots folder." slopes_lin_liahovden_120 <- conc_liahovden |>   flux_fitting(fit_type = "linear", end_cut = 120) |>     flux_quality(fit_type = "linear")  slopes_lin_liahovden_120 |>   dplyr::filter(f_fluxID %in% c(53:56)) |> # we just show a sample of the plots to avoid slowing down the example     flux_plot(       fit_type = "lin",       print_plot = TRUE,       f_plotname = "example_lia_lin",       f_ylim_lower = 300,       f_ylim_upper = 600,       f_nrow = 1       ) #> [1] "Saving plots in f_quality_plots folder." slopes_exp_liahovden <- flux_fitting(conc_liahovden, fit_type = "exponential") #> Warning in flux_fitting_exp(conc_df, start_cut = ((start_cut)), end_cut = ((end_cut)), :  #>  fluxID 77 : slope was estimated on 194 points out of 210 seconds because data are missing #>  fluxID 85 : slope was estimated on 175 points out of 210 seconds because data are missing head(slopes_exp_liahovden) #> # A tibble: 6 × 30 #>   f_datetime          temp_air temp_soil f_conc   PAR turfID   type  #>   <dttm>                 <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    <chr> #> 1 2022-07-27 05:37:40       NA        NA   465. NA 4 AN1C 4 NEE   #> # ℹ 23 more variables: f_start <dttm>, f_end <dttm>, f_fluxID <fct>, #> #   f_n_conc <int>, f_ratio <dbl>, f_flag_match <chr>, f_time <dbl>, #> #   f_cut <fct>, n_conc <int>, Cm_est <dbl>, a_est <dbl>, b_est <dbl>, #> #   tz_est <dbl>, f_Cz <dbl>, time_diff <dbl>, f_Cm <dbl>, f_a <dbl>, #> #   f_b <dbl>, f_tz <dbl>, f_slope_tz <dbl>, f_fit <dbl>, f_fit_slope <dbl>, #> #   f_start_z <dttm> slopes_exp_liahovden <- flux_quality(slopes_exp_liahovden, fit_type = "expo", slope_col = "f_slope_tz") head(slopes_exp_liahovden) #> # A tibble: 6 × 37 #>   f_datetime          temp_air temp_soil f_conc   PAR turfID   type  #>   <dttm>                 <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    <chr> #> 1 2022-07-27 05:37:40       NA        NA   465.   tz_est <dbl>, f_Cz <dbl>, time_diff <dbl>, f_Cm <dbl>, f_a <dbl>, #> #   f_b <dbl>, f_tz <dbl>, f_slope_tz <dbl>, f_fit <dbl>, f_fit_slope <dbl>, #> #   f_start_z <dttm>, f_cor_coef <dbl>, f_RMSE <dbl>, f_start_error <chr>, #> # we just show a sample of the plots to avoid slowing down the example     flux_plot(       fit_type = "exp",       print_plot = TRUE,       f_plotname = "example_lia_lin",       f_ylim_lower = 300,       f_ylim_upper = 600,       f_nrow = 1       ) #> [1] "Saving plots in f_quality_plots folder." fluxes_exp_liahovden <- slopes_exp_liahovden |>   flux_calc(     slope_col = "f_slope_corr", #
